intro: Stelis stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are narrow and strap-like, contributing to its common name. Stelis stenophylla is valued in horticulture for its elegant appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
